thread.section_title: Stock Market & Finance News - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: Banks Forecast Gains for Crude Oil

author: Christopher Alessi
title: Banks Forecast Gains for Crude Oil

organizations.name: banks forecast gains for crude oil

text:
LONDON—Banks raised their forecasts for oil prices for the sixth month in a row in March, in a sign they expect draining crude inventories and rising geopolitical risks to global supply to further balance the market in the coming months.
Brent crude—the global benchmark—is now expected to average $63 a barrel this year, while West Texas Intermediate, the U.S. standard, should average close to $59 a barrel, according to a poll of 15 investment banks surveyed by The Wall Street Journal toward the end of March. Both estimates...
